newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador to hike petrol tax, add new taxes - report.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador to hike petrol tax, add new taxes - report.

text.p: Ecuador's government is set to raise petrol taxes and create other new taxes in its effort to cover an estimated budget gap of 6.6 percent of gross domestic product this year, daily El Telegrafo reported Thursday.

"One of the measures is the reduction in the profit margin of service stations and a rise in the price of petrol. We are also creating taxes on mobile telephone and cable television use," El Telegrafo said, citing statements made by Danilo Carrera, president of the monetary board, in London.

The article did not specify the percentage rise in petrol taxes but said it should generate $50 million revenue a month. It said the government hopes to raise $44 million a month by reducing service stations' profit margins.
El Telegrafo also quoted Carrera saying $33 million would be raised by an eight percent financial tax.
